channel.description: Recent content in Welcome on Bomb Jack Docs

item.title: Memory Map
item.description: The following table shows a short overview of Bomb Jack memory map as seen and used by Z80.

item.title: Character Map
item.description: Character map combined with attribute map creates BG_1 - second of the three layers of graphics.

item.title: Attribute Map
item.description: Attribute map is strictly related to character map, both are used to create BG_1 layer.

item.title: Object Attribute Memory
item.description: Object attribute memory holds the information about objects (also reffered as sprites) to be displayed. It creates last of the three layers of graphics.

item.title: Object Size Select
item.description:
Size select registers define how many and which entries in OAM are displayed as 32*32 objects.

⚠️ The following information is partly based on the research done by Martin Piper and it’s not properly emulated by MAME as of the time of writing.

item.title: Color Palette Memory
item.description: Color palette memory holds user defined palettes. They can be applied to characters and objects used to create graphics layers.

item.title: Background Picture Select
item.description: Background picture select register simplifies setting of character and attribute maps for BG_0.

item.title: Dip Switch Settings
item.description: Bomb Jack PCB has two dip switches to configure game settings. How the game accesses and makes use of them is explained right here.
